> [{quoted}](name=redfeenix,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YRkNrnHN,comment-id=0001000500000005,timestamp=2017-01-30T20:51:25.181+0000)
>
> I'd like to come work on unannounced projects at Rito. I have some great ideas for a League RTS (Armies of Runterra) and some arcade games. 
> 
> Any tips on how I can get hired at RnD? Sounds like a blast.

R&D is one of the hardest parts of Riot to get hired into - you generally need to be a subject matter expert on the genre or type of project that is being worked on, and at  senior level experience (so that you can help hire a team of more junior folks when you get out of the small scrappy team phase).

It can be heartbreaking (because so many experiments are thrown away - and you put your heart and soul into every one), but amazing.

So best advice is - go out, make games, get noticed! :D

I didn't know that was what it was called.
Yes, and that undercut is horrendous. It makes my guts shiver.

I think her hair is adorable, trendy, very light for summer, and exactly what a noble socialite would wear if she was going on vacation. I love the hairstyle, it's such a deviance from her normal hair, so it's nice to have some change.

Thanks for your constructive comment, it helped me think about the topic from a different perspective. I can kind of see what you're saying. And I agree, change can be good sometimes. 

I don't follow what modern nobles/aristocrats/celebrities/upper-class/rich do so I can't say I'm experienced in their current trends. I also can't say anything objectively since this topic is largely subjective. 

So what I'm about to say is pretty biased. When I think undercut, I think of Miley Cyrus or  {{champion:119}}, people who try to be (a lack of a better word) 'edgy'.  When I think of nobility, I think of those old fancy European parties where the women wore a lot of powder and had big dresses. I don't think Fiora would get that 'edgy' haircut as it would risk hurting her noble family public image. She seems too elegant and self-restrained to do that as well. Fact is, the haircut breaks away from the 'normal' or traditional haircuts today, so its return was intended to make a statement or to 'stand-out'. Of course, maybe Fiora decided it was time for change.

Admittedly though, after looking at some of the images of undercuts from that Bioluminescence linked, it does look really cute on some women...
Doesn't mean they are going to change it just because u said u dont like it.
Only if a LARGE amount of the community hated it like they did with her VU hair style, they'd change it.  I see nothing wrong with this myself.

> Only if a LARGE amount of the community hated it like they did with her VU hair style, they'd change it.  I see nothing wrong with this myself.

Exactly. In the thread I only voiced my opinion and thoughts about it and asked the community for their opinion on the hair. I never said anything about changing it. Only if there was a large percentage of the community who disliked it, would I consider making a thread about changing it.

I'm not particularly fond of it either. I feel like way too much is going on with her hair. I feel it transitions poorly? I really wish the skin had more of her default hair due. 

Beyond that my other issue falls with the palette of the skin, I feel the color choices could be a little bit better. Either go all the way blue or go all the way purple. Going both feels weird. But it's minor.

Honestly I don't see the biggie. I think it's really fashionable and quite cute. It's modern, it's Chic. 
Beyond plain personal preference I think it's a medium choice, but I don't see a point in changing it. 
The main reason I've seen people disliking it is because of 'SJWs' and 'Lesbian haircut' etc.

I didn't read anything about 'SJWs' and 'Lesbian haircuts', just some people who needed to pick their words better. Maybe I'm not good at reading in-between the lines. Anyways, thanks for your opinion.

To clarify, I don't have a problem with the haircut itself, I just don't think it fits Fiora. She comes off to me as being elegant and refined and doesn't need to make a statement with her hair. Again, maybe I'm just bad at reading in-between the lines. Maybe for summer she wanted to try something edgy. Maybe I'm too old and I don't know what is fashionable these days.
How can you not have a problem with the cut itself? Does it not make you want to kill yourself when you see one in the street? It does for me.

We're all entitled to our own opinions and my opinion is the cut itself is fine. In the original post, I stated that I thought it was random, as it did come out unexpectedly of her. Simply put, I don't think it matches Fiora. 

I respect your opinion but my response is no to your question. I'd wish you'd pick better words to express your thoughts though.

If you do have a huge issue with it, you should ask a bigger community such as reddit for their opinion or you can start your own thread.
